title: IMF delegation to arrive in Sri Lanka in two days
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); A delegation from the International Monetary Fund is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on 20th June, says the Ministry of Finance.

The Ministry of Finance stated that the relevant delegation will visit Sri Lanka with the intention of furthering the ongoing discussions regarding bailout to be obtained from the International Monetary Fund.
They are scheduled to meet the President, the Prime Minister, officials of the Ministry of Finance and Central Bank officials, the Ministry of Finance added.
